page.title: 03BRIT
page.content: The Britannia Inn was once a small Inn set between three cottages that date back to the 15 C. Owned by Llantysilio Estate untill after the second world war. They were sold to the Williams' in the 1940's and eventually the Inn was extended taking over the three cottages. The Inn has changed hands four times,to date the present owners Mr. and Mrs. C.Aston, have done a lot of improvements, and have won many awards for tourism,and 'The garden in bloom' competitions. The Britannia Inn orignally stood on the main road but due to a fatal coach crash in 1950, involving a Sunday School party from Chirk, the road was altered giving more ground to the Inn.
